website_summaries.verdict: A well-built fixie bike with a rear wheel hub that allows for switching between single-speed and fixed gear.
pros: A stylish and elegantly designed bike that is ideal for commuters with its simple design
The rugged steel frame holds up well and is light, bringing the whole bike to 22 to 24 pounds, depending on size
Seven frame sizes available in 22 colors
cons: The tires are prone to flats and may need replacing early

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was excellent, I almost did not want remove the bike in order to preserve the work of art. The bike is beautiful, and well worth the cost. I will update the review if needed. I plan on using daily to commute to work 5 miles one way (100% flat asphalt), be healthy and reduce my carbon footprint. I am 5'9" with ~33" inseam, the 54 cm is a perfect fit. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: limarj

customer_reviews.title: Digging it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Pure Fix for less than a week but I love it. It's a good looking bike that has already garnered me a handful of compliments. The ride is smooth and sturdy. As I expected there are a few things I'll want to upgrade in the near future, namely the seat and pedals, but for the price is s steal!

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how low quality the Kenda Kwest tires are. They pop off the rim SO easily, and this has happened even while I was riding it. Additionally, I'm really disappointed with how poor the rim strips are, as well the brake pads. I want to replace the tires, rim strips, and brake pads because of how terrible they all are. Because of the good rating of this bike on amazon, I was happy to spend over $300 on this, but now I have severe buyer's remorse. Perhaps Pure Fix will see this review and accommodate me, but I've had such bad experiences with most bike companies' customer service that I'm skeptical they will.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

product_meta.title: Pure Fix Original Fixed Gear Single Speed Fixie Bike
product_meta.description: Pure Cycles created the ultimate Pure Fix Original Fixed Gear single speed bicycle starting with the simplicity and elegance of an urban geometry frame and straight fork made from durable high tensile steel. A Neco threadless Headset holds pure Fix riser bars with Oury grips on a pure Fix stem. The v drome saddle provides a nice mix of comfort and raciness. Promax front brakes stop when asked and are easily removed for a purist ride. Hubs are custom Pure Fix lasered KT quandos. Wtb Thick Slick tires 700cc x 28 tires give you control and contact. Pressure retention is courtesy of 60mm Presta valves. Pure Fix pedals connect you to a three-piece sealed bearing crank set. The gear ratio is 44:16 with 74.25 gear inches using a KMC chain. All this joy comes out with a weight of 22-24 lbs., depending on size. Pure Cycles bicycles are built to live, ride and thrive right where you do. Includes a manufacturer's lifetime warranty on frames and a 1-year warranty on components (professional assembly is required to activate your warranty). Celebrating bicycling for all that it offers, Pure Cycles, built to live, ride, and thrive right where you do offers a variety of frame, geometry, and gearing options as well as a cornucopia of compatible accessories, including different styles of handlebars, saddles, water bottle cages, foot straps, and more.
feature_bullets: Fixed gear single speed fixie bicycle with deep-dish 50mm wheels
Flip-flop rear wheel hub allows changing from single-speed to fixed gear with ease
High-tensile, fully Tig-welded steel frame is built to last

Easily removable front brake; Wheelset: Pure Cycles 40mm Deep-Dish 32-Hole Rims, Alloy Flip-Flop Hubs; Chain:KMC Z-410; Handlebar:Pure Cycles alloy 30mm Riser;Stem:Pure Cycles Alloy;Grips:Pure Cycles Rubber, No Flange
Brand name components include Kenda Tires and Tubes, Oury Grips and KMC Chain
